alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 04 at 4:09AM PST until March 04 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches 700 feet and higher, except less than one inch below 700 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to be 500 to 1000 feet late through Saturday morning. This means the most likely outcome for the lower elevations is a dusting at most.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
